meanings.definition: Misalters: plural noun form of misalter, someone who alters something incorrectly
meanings.sent1: The misalters in the workshop often made mistakes while trying to fix the broken machines.
meanings.sent2: The misalters were known for their unintentional changes to the original designs.
meanings.sent3: The misalters at the art class accidentally turned the still life painting into an abstract masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: The misalters in the storybook were like clumsy wizards, always casting spells that went awry.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the misalters, for their touch can turn gold into lead.

meanings.definition: Misalters: third person present tense of misalter, to alter something incorrectly
meanings.sent1: She misalters the recipe every time she tries to bake a cake.
meanings.sent2: He misalters the code and ends up crashing the entire program.
meanings.sent3: The cat misalters the yarn into a tangled mess whenever it gets a chance.
meanings.sent4: The misalters of fate twisted the course of their lives in unexpected ways.
meanings.sent5: The misalters of time altered the memories, making them fade into oblivion.
